name: Rectosigmoid Junction Adenomyomatosis
chief_complaint: I have severe lower abdominal pain and bloody stools for the past two weeks
physical_findings: tenderness on deep palpation of left lower quadrant
palpable mass in rectosigmoid region on digital rectal exam
treatment: surgical resection of affected segment (sigmoidectomy with primary anastomosis)
temporary diverting ileostomy in select cases
prognosis: Good with complete surgical resection, but requires long-term surveillance due to rare malignant transformation potential
description: A rare benign condition characterized by heterotopic proliferation of glandular epithelium and smooth muscle in the rectosigmoid junction wall, causing stricture-like symptoms. Often misdiagnosed as malignancy or inflammatory bowel disease due to similar presentation.
